sub_title: Passionate educator, information & communication professional with a proven track record of delivering innovative solutions and driving academic excellence.
summary:
Ayodele John Ayodele is an experienced educator & digerati who holds a Ph.D. in Communication and Information Studies. His knowledge encompasses various fields, including Library Science, Communication & Information Science, Archives and Record Management, and Publishing & Copyright Studies. Currently affiliated with the University of Ibadan in Nigeria, Ayodele has amassed over 18 years of experience leveraging Information Communication Technology (ICT) to drive innovation 
 achieve organizational objectives.

He is widely respected for his outstanding contributions to the fields of librarianship and information science. He has authored a good number of publications in prestigious academic journals worldwide, showcasing his expertise in scholarly research and dedication to scientific excellence. He excels in transforming research proposals into actionable methodologies that optimize outcomes and yield measurable results.

Beyond his research keenness, Dr. Alonge is a proficient team manager & developer, demonstrating excellence in classroom and project management, as well as process improvement. He possesses exceptional problem-solving skills, thrives in collaborative environments, and has a proven track record of delivering tangible and quantifiable outcomes that benefit both his team and the organization as a whole.

Academically, Dr. Alonge holds a Ph.D. in Communication&  Information Studies from the School of Journalism & Mass Communication at the University of Nairobi, Kenya. He also holds a Master of Publishing & Copyright Studies (MPCS) & a Bachelor of Library and Information Studies with a specialization in Communication and Language Arts from the Department of Library, Archival & Information Studies at the University of Ibadan, Nigeria. Additionally, he possesses a Nigerian Certificate in Education (English and Political Science) from Kwara State College of Education, Oro, Nigeria.

Dr. Alonge's areas of expertise encompass a wide range of skills, including ICT proficiency, educational program development, information management, library management, intercultural partnerships, youth development, advisory and consultancy services, learning management systems, administrative support, project management, graphic design, digital marketing, digital technology, social media management, training and development, and leadership skills.

Dr. Alonge is happily married, cherishing his delightful wife and children as true blessings. They serve as an invaluable source of motivation, propelling him forward in both his personal and professional endeavors.

treasury_media.title: Libraries and Librarians as innovators - Dr Ayodele John Alonge
treasury_media.description: In his keynote speech at the 30th Anniversary and Conference of the Nigerian Library Association Delta State Chapter, Dr. Ayodele John Alonge emphasized the crucial need for continuous innovation and creativity in libraries to meet the demands of the 21st century. He highlighted the transition from traditional print formats to electronic formats, the importance of user satisfaction, and the pivotal role of libraries in providing efficient and effective services.

awards.title: Most Supportive Lecturer Award 2019-2021 Academic Session"
awards.description:
Most Supportive Lecturer Award 2019-2021 Academic Session 
I express my deep appreciation to the LIBRARY, ARCHIVAL AND INFORMATION SCIENCE STUDENTS' ASSOCIATION (LARISSA) Library, Archival and Information Studies Students Association for bestowing upon me this great honour "Most Supportive Lecturer Award 2019-2021 Academic Session"  

This award is dedicated to my teachers in all the colleges and other institutions that I passed through. Thanks  for being supportive teachers and  for teaching me how to teach and impact the life of other others.

awards.issuer: Library, Archival and Information Studies Students Association

awards.title: Carnegie CPD Award
awards.description:
Enhancing librarians' ICT skills for research enablement in African universities: a Carnegie CPD programme  

The Department of Information Science, University of Pretoria, was awarded a grant by the Carnegie Corporation of New York to offer eight four-week residential continuing professional development (CPD) programmes for qualified librarians from Sub-Saharan Africa, for the period 2014 – 2016. 

The aims of the programme are to:

Empower the next generation of library and information professionals within Sub-Saharan African countries with hands-on skills to apply current and emerging information and communication technologies (ICTs);
Build capacity amongst library and information services (LIS) professionals to support and enable researchers.

profile_positions.description:
📚 Teaching: I employ diverse pedagogical techniques to foster active, collaborative, and experiential learning experiences in Information Science, Library Science, and Communication Studies. This involves assessing student performance, monitoring academic progress and development.

🔬 Research: I play a crucial role in translating specific research inquiries into functional and analytical designs and methodologies, as well as operationalizing conceptual variables to facilitate research implementation.

🤝 Community Service: Additionally, I am dedicated to giving back to society by leveraging my skills and talents to support and uplift the community.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Explore, Evaluate, Promote, and Implement various emerging technologies in the University of Ibadan library System ”

•Track trends, investigate new developments and applications, and incorporate appropriate 
  technologies into the library environment to improve library services and access to information.
 
•Share technology knowledge and train others to improve skills of library staff and encourage   
  integration of technology into the library’s physical and virtual presence.

•Serve as social media librarian: by ensuring web presence of University of Ibadan library system
profile_positions.title: Emerging Technology Librarian

profile_positions.description:
At Optimistic Concept Services, I play a pivotal role in:

📚 Library Management: Proficiently setting up and overseeing libraries, both physical and digital, to ensure the highest standards of organization and accessibility. My expertise encompasses application oif ICT in cataloging, editing, indexing, and circulation, as well as successful project management for magazine and journal publications. I specialise in ePublishing, harnessing digital platforms for effective content dissemination.

📊 Information Management: Adeptly handling various types of information, including classification, storage, and retrieval, while implementing streamlined information management systems. My focus is on supporting informed decision-making, data security, and regulatory compliance.

🗣️ Communication Management: Skillfully managing internal and external communication channels to foster collaboration and transparency. I develop communication strategies aligned with organizational goals, promoting effective information dissemination. In times of crisis, I handle challenges with professionalism and agility.

📖 Publishing Consulting: Offering expert guidance to publishers and authors as they navigate the ever-evolving publishing industry landscape. I provide strategic insights to optimize content creation, distribution, and audience engagement, leveraging market trends and emerging technologies to drive publishing success.

🎓 Education and Training: Additionally, I am actively involved in hands-on learning, workshops, and seminars focused on life skills. These initiatives contribute to personal and professional development, enhancing the overall growth and effectiveness of our team and clients.
